translation: "I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the original teacher, the great lord of the teachings, for the common realization of the Dharma kings in ten directions, for the universal assembly of the sages and virtuous beings in Laṅkāra, the eight divisions of the gods, and the vajra, and for the sharing of the short commentary by Aoi heart. I was saddened by the legacy of the teachings, by the absence of a good understanding, and by the midnight examination of my own mind. In the morning, I discussed the topic with the white clouds, and in the evening, I left the bright moon to accompany me. Although I may have been manipulating the calabash to peer into the heavens and the Han, I really felt ashamed of the mouse drinking from the river. I hope these words don't contradict the sūtras' tenor, and that they will be granted currency in ten directions so that those who practice the perfect penetration will surely attain the Tathāgata's pure store.
